meanings.sent1: She was stodging away at her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: The ants were stodging to gather food for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel was stodging around trying to lift the acorn.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete kept stodging forward towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The students were stodging through the challenging math problems.

meanings.sent1: The cake had a stodging consistency that made it hard to cut.
meanings.sent2: The old book had stodging pages that were difficult to turn.
meanings.sent3: The stodging mud stuck to their shoes as they walked through the field.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog had a stodging effect on visibility.
meanings.sent5: The stew had a stodging feel in the mouth, comforting and filling.

meanings.sent1: The stew had a stodging that warmed them up on a cold day.
